position.marginalia_text: Mulieru[m] genitur[a]e, vt recipiunt aliquid discriminis in iudica[n]di r[ati]o[n]e: propter eas res diuersas qu[a]e in earu[m] consideratio[n]e perpenduntur vt in illis de maritis querim[us], [etc] nec magistratum gerunt / [etc].

marginalia.translation: Women's genitures, as they recover something of a distinction in the reason for judgment: among those diverse matters which are assessed carefully in their consideration as in them we search for [information] on wifes, et cetera, and do not take up office.

position.marginalia_text: Imo &Sun; vit[a]e dator in &Trine; ascende[n]tis et in 9 and D[omi]n[u]s asce[n]dentis in &Sextile;, dispositoris &Moon;, et &Venus; in &Conjunction; &Moon; ip[s]am conservant / casibus tali[bus] violentis subijcietur. //

marginalia.translation: Indeed, the Sun [is] the giver of life in trine to the ascendant and in the ninth [house], and the Lord of the Ascendant in sextile, the dispositor of the Moon. And Venus in conjunction with the Moon; they conserve it [as] it is subjected to such violent cases.
